definition: double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time

sentences.english: Her husband has only been able to find part-time work at a gasoline station.
sentences.chinese: 她的丈夫只能够找到一个加油站兼职工作。

sentences.english: I started teaching ESL part-time (English as a Second Language) in 2003.
sentences.chinese: 当作兼职，我从2003年开始教非母语英语课程。

sentences.english: D adviser for School of Information and Telecommunication Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications (BUPT).
sentences.chinese: 北京邮电大学信息与通信工程学院兼职博导。

sentences.english: I only work part-time, two days a week.
sentences.chinese: 我只做兼职，一周上两天班。

sentences.english: They acknowledge that holding a part-time job can teach teens about responsibility and teamwork.
sentences.chinese: 他们承认做兼职工作能使青少年有责任感和团队精神。

sentences.english: Our quality of life will be improved after doing part-time and summer jobs.
sentences.chinese: 做兼职或暑期工会对我们的生活水平有好处。

sentences.english: I loved English so much that I began taking up part-time jobs as a translator and interpreter.
sentences.chinese: 当时太喜欢这个专业了，在校期间就开始做兼职翻译。

sentences.english: I had a part-time job somewhere where I lived previously, at a grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 我之前在原来住的地方有份兼职工作，在一家杂货店。

sentences.english: You may qualify for rent discount by doing part-time groundskeeping.
sentences.chinese: 做草地维护的兼职或者可以让你享受租金折扣价哦。

sentences.english: What kind of part-time job is popular?
He sometimes moonlights as a chef at Rover's, a French restaurant in Seattle.
sentences.chinese: 他有时去西雅图一家法国餐厅“罗浮”兼职当主厨。

sentences.english: Part-time and summer jobs can broaden horizon.
sentences.chinese: 兼职及暑期工能扩阔视野。

sentences.english: just because I've always done very specialized projects, and projects I've worked almost part time.
sentences.chinese: 因为我做的都是比较特殊的项目，很多都是兼职。

sentences.english: They tend to work part- time on one -off projects.
sentences.chinese: 他们倾向于在一次性项目上发展兼职工作。

sentences.english: They do not agree with college students having a part-time job in their spare time.
sentences.chinese: 他们不赞成大学生利用业余时间做兼职。

definition: special duty/assigned full time to a task
to work part time while studying/work-study program
to teach as substitute for absent teacher
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
to accept a job offer/to apply for an advertised position
to work/(of a machine) to operate/job/work/task/CL:個|个[ge4],份[fen4],項|项[xiang4]
